custodian.name: Metadata Technology North America Inc.
custodian.description: Metadata Technology North America (MTNA) is a U.S. based small business that provides high level expertise around the technical management of statistical and scientific data.

provenance.description: Data is collected from official and popular data sources from around the world.
provenance.curation: Various tools and techniques are typically used to enhance data quality and capture metadata for publication oin our Rich Data Services platform.

sources.name: Johns Hopkins University CCSE
sources.description: COVID-19 Data Repository by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University
sources.curation: Pythons scripts are used to harvest the COVID-19 daily reports CSV files, reorganize in multiple datasets (global, national, subnational), address geo-entities spelling variations, create new categorical variables using standard codes, and perform other adjustements.

sources.name: Google COVID-19 Community Mobility Reports
sources.curation: Pythons scripts are used to harvest the CSV files, reorganize in multiple datasets, and perform other adjustements.

sources.name: Government of Canada Outbreak Update
sources.curation: Data product is created through cleaning and simple transformations applied to the CSV files
